Detailed Description

Configuration for a conflatee.

Member Data Documentation

void(* conflate_config_t::get_stats)(void *udata, void *opaque, char *type, kvpair_t *form, conflate_add_stat cb)

Callback issued when libconflate wants to report stats.

The client is expected to call the conflate_add_stat callback once for every stat it wishes to report along with the given opaque, followed by one invocation with two NULLs.

Parameters:
udata The client's custom user data
opaque an opaque value that must be supplied to the callback
type primary stat type (may be NULL)
form detailed stat request form (may be NULL)
cb the callback into which stats will be fed

char* conflate_config_t::host

The XMPP server address.

This is optional -- setting this to NULL will allow for normal XMPP SRV lookups to locate the server.

void(* conflate_config_t::new_config)(void *, kvpair_t *)

Callback issued when a new configuration is to be activated.

This callback will receive the caller's userdata and a kvpair_t of all of the keys and values received when things changed.

The new config *may* be the same as the previous config. It's up to the client to detect and decide what to do in this case.

void(* conflate_config_t::ping_test)(void *userdata, void *opaque, kvpair_t *form, conflate_add_ping_report cb)

Callback issued when libconflate would like to run a ping test against a series of servers.

Parameters:
userdata user's callback info
opaque an opaque that must be given to the callback unmodified
servers null-terminated list of null-terminated strings
cb callback to issue at the end of each test result

void(* conflate_config_t::reset_stats)(void *udata, char *type, kvpair_t *form)

Callback issued when libconflate wants to reset stats.

Parameters:
udata the client's custom user data
type stat type to clear (may be NULL)
form detailed stat request form (may be NULL)

char* conflate_config_t::software

Name of the software using libconflate.

For example: awesomeproxy

char* conflate_config_t::version

Version number of the software running libconflate.

For example: 1.3.3-8-gee0c3d5
